result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dean J Seppi was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $1,725.00. Remaining balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

BAIL APPLIED TO DNA AND BLOOD COSTS.
Blood costs will be forwarded to the City of Brookfield Police.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Absolute sobriety.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Court recommends the Dept of Corrections supervise the defendant in accordance with the standards defined in DOC Administrative Directive 10-04.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dean J Seppi in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing.   The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

48 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 134 days)
  -  20 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  28 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;   
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
*The court recommends the Department of Corrections supervise the defendant in accordance with the standards defined in DOC Administrative Directive 10-04.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $25.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to City of Brookfield Police Department);

FINE:  $2658.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);

DNA Surcharge $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting/appeal rights and firearms warnings given.

$2000.00 of the bail to be applied to the fine/costs and refund the balance to the poster

Attorney Bailey files and Motion staying the sentence pending appeal.  State objects to any stay. Defense presents arguments.
Court denied the Motion.
exhibits 1, 2, 3 and 5
and stipulation and order for return/destruction of exhibits.  Exhibit #4 is not scannable.
Juror's selection and peremptory challenges, Random Listing Report - Voir Dire
Stipulation as to the blood test

Defendant Dean J Seppi in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for Jury Trial @ 08:42 am. Parties stipulate to the blood test results. Court addressed the State's Motion in Limine. Jurors enter courtroom @ 9:20 am. Clerk gives oath to jurors on voir dire.  Court conducts Voir Dire. State and defense conduct voir dire. Jury is selected and the balance of jurors are released @ 9:54 am. Clerk swears the jury panel that is selected. State makes opening statements. Defense requests side-bar. Defense makes opening statements. Officer Andrew Hansen from the City of Brookfield was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State plays DVD. Cross examination by the defense. Defense requests side-bar. Redirect by the state. Officer Nolen from the City of Brookfield was sworn and testified on behalf of the state. Jurors are released for lunch 11:44 am. Defense counsel moves for dismissal. State objects. Court denied the Motion. Court takes recess @ 11:50 am. Court reconved @ 12:47 pm. Jurors enter courtroom. State rests.  Mathew Geboy was sworn and testified on behalf of the defense. Cross examination by the state. Douglas McCarthy Was sworn and testified on behalf of the Defense. Cross examination by the state. Court takes recesss 1:24 pm. Court reconved @ 1:34 pm. Dean Seppi was sworn and testified on his own behalf. Cross examination by the state. Defense rests.  Officer Hansen previously sworn, was called for rebuttal testimony. Cross examination by the defense. Jurors leave the courtroom  2:10 pm. Parties address the jury instructions. Jurors re-enter courtroom @ 2:40 pm. Court instructs the jurors. State presents closing arguments. Defense presents closing arguments. Further arguments by the state. Court further instructs the jurors and the clerk swears in the bailiff. Jurors leave the courtroom to deliberate @  3:11 pm.  Jurors have reached a verdict at 3:59 pm.  Jurors enter the courtroom @ 4:07 pm. Court reads the verdicts and the jurors have found the defendant guilty of the OAWI and the PAC of the amended information.  Court polls the jurors. State requests the court to enters judgment as to count 1 and count 2 is dismissed outright. Defendant taken into custody. Bail as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
filed by State

Defendant Dean J Seppi in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addressed Attorney Weather's motion to withdraw and defendant's motion to modify bail. Attorney Weathers advised court that the Public Defender's Office has found successor counsel. Defendant has no objection to Attorney Weather's motion to withdraw as counsel. Court grants motion to withdraw as counsel and cancels trial.  New counsel will be Attorney Mike Jakus. Court addressed defendant's bail motion. Court advised defendant that his bail is $4000.00 cash with huber bailee status. Court denies defendant's request to modify bail and will take no action until a new attorney is assigned.  Hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
